data.text:
22 Notable alumni of

Seijo University

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

Seijo University is 339th in the world, 66th in Asia, and 28th in Japan by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 22 notable alumni from Seijo University sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.

Masakazu Tamura

Born in

Japan

Years

1943-2021 (aged 78)

Occupations

film actortelevision actor

Biography

Masakazu Tamura was a Japanese film and theatre actor.

Yoshino Kimura

Born in

United Kingdom

Years

1976-.. (age 48)

Occupations

singeractorseiyū

Biography

Yoshino Kimura is a Japanese actress and singer. She appeared on an episode of the Showtime series Masters of Horror. Kimura won the "Rookie of the Year" prize at the 21st Japan Academy Awards for her appearance in Shitsurakuen.

Mitsuhiro Oikawa

Born in

Japan

Years

1969-.. (age 55)

Occupations

actorsingersongwriter

Biography

Mitsuhiro Oikawa is a Japanese musician, singer-songwriter, composer and actor who is represented by the talent agency, Mother Enterprise. He graduated from Seijo Gakuen Junior High School and High School and Seijo University Faculty of Law. He is business partners with Horipro. His wife was actress and Takarazuka Revue graduate Rei Dan (July 2011 - Nov 2018).

Yukiyoshi Ozawa

Born in

United States

Years

1974-.. (age 50)

Occupations

film actoractor

Biography

Yukiyoshi Ozawa is an American-born Japanese actor. He gained notable fame near the end of 2017 for his involvement in the Long Long Man commercials produced by UHA for their Sakeru Gummy brand, in which he portrayed the titular character.

Hitonari Tsuji

Born in

Japan

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

Occupations

composerscreenwriterwritersingerfilm director

Biography

Hitonari Tsuji is a Tokyo-born Japanese writer, composer, and film director. In his film and singing work he uses the name Jinsei Tsuji, an alternative reading of the Japanese writing of his name. He debuted as a writer in 1989. His books and stories have been bestsellers in Japan as well as overseas, with his work being translated into 20 languages and selling over ten million copies.

Shima Iwashita

Born in

Japan

Years

1941-.. (age 83)

Occupations

film actoractor

Biography

Shima Iwashita is a Japanese stage and film actress who has appeared in films of Yasujirō Ozu, Keisuke Kinoshita, Masaki Kobayashi and most frequently of Masahiro Shinoda, her husband.

Naotarō Moriyama

Born in

Japan

Years

1976-.. (age 48)

Occupations

singersinger-songwritermusician

Biography

Naotarō Moriyama is a Japanese pop singer-songwriter. His mother is Ryōko Moriyama, a well-known folk singer.

Mayu Tsuruta

Born in

Japan

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Occupations

seiyūactor

Biography

Mayu Tsuruta is an actress. In 1996 she was nominated by the Award of the Japanese Academy for Best Supporting Actress in the film Kike wadatsumi no koe Last Friends. Following the chaos of Kenya's 2007 presidential election, on March 30, 2008, she visited thousands of internal refugees at Kenya's Nakuru ASK grounds, as a goodwill ambassador for Tokyo International Conference on African Development. While surveying the situation at the refugee camp, she spent time with several families and helped distribute food aid.

Tsutomu Hata

Born in

Japan

Years

1935-2017 (aged 82)

Occupations

politiciandiplomat

Biography

Tsutomu Hata was a Japanese politician who served as Prime Minister of Japan for nine weeks in 1994. He took over from Morihiro Hosokawa at the head of a coalition government. Shortly after he had been appointed Prime Minister, the Japanese Socialist Party left the government, leading to his early departure from office. He was a member of the lower house representing Nagano district #3. He was elected 14 times, retiring in 2012.

Nobuhiko Obayashi

Born in

Japan

Years

1938-2020 (aged 82)

Occupations

composertelevision producertelevision directorfilm directorscreenwriter

Biography

Nobuhiko Obayashi was a Japanese director, screenwriter and editor of films and television advertisements. He began his filmmaking career as a pioneer of Japanese experimental films before transitioning to directing more mainstream media, and his resulting filmography as a director spanned almost 60 years. He is best known as the director of the 1977 horror film House, which has garnered a cult following. He was notable for his distinct surreal filmmaking style, as well as the anti-war themes commonly embedded in his films.

Tomu Mutō

Born in

Japan

Years

1994-.. (age 30)

Occupations

singer

Biography

Tomu Mutō is a Japanese tarento, actress, and former idol. She was a member of the idol group AKB48 under Team K. She is an alumna of Seijo University, where she studied economics and also earned her postgraduate degree, as well as a certified weather presenter, financial planner and a disaster prevention specialist.

Yūko Obuchi

Born in

Japan

Years

1973-.. (age 51)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Yuko Obuchi is a Japanese politician. She is a member of the House of Representatives for the Liberal Democratic Party. She briefly served as Minister of Economy, Trade and Industry during the Abe government, but was forced to resign. She is the second daughter of Keizo Obuchi, who served as Prime Minister of Japan from 1998 until his death in office in 2000.

Yasuhide Nakayama

Born in

Japan

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Occupations

international forum participantpolitician

Biography

Yasuhide Nakayama is a Japanese politician who served as the Senior Vice Minister of Defense of Japan. A member of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), he was elected in December 2012 as a member of the House of Representatives of Japan and re-elected in the December 2015 and 2017 elections. After the snap elections in October 2017, Nakayama was appointed the Chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee. He lost his seat in the House in the 2021 Japanese general election.

Yoshihiro Nakamura

Born in

Japan

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Occupations

screenwriterfilm director

Biography

Yoshihiro Nakamura is a Japanese film director and screenwriter, known for his 2009 film Fish Story, which premiered at the New York Asian Film Festival, and A Boy and His Samurai, which won the Audience Award at the 2011 New York Asian Film Festival.

Mai

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Occupations

singer

Biography

Mai Fujisawa is a Japanese singer, songwriter, and lyricist. She has released four studio albums and has performed for several soundtracks. Fujisawa has collaborated on several occasions with her father, composer Joe Hisaishi, on the soundtracks for the films of Studio Ghibli. She has also performed on the soundtracks of other media, including the film Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2 (2011) and the video game Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch (2011).

Yoko Komiyama

Born in

Japan

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

television presenterannouncerpolitician

Biography

Yoko Komiyama is a Japanese politician of the Democratic Party of Japan, a member of the House of Representatives in the Diet (national legislature). A native of Shibuya, Tokyo and graduate of Seijo University, she worked at the public broadcaster NHK from 1972 to 1998. She was elected to the House of Councilors for the first time in 1998 and then to the House of Representatives for the first time in April 2003. In September 2011 she was appointed Minister of Health, Labour and Welfare in the cabinet of newly appointed prime minister Yoshihiko Noda.

Taku Etō

Born in

Japan

Years

1960-.. (age 64)

Enrolled in Seijo University

In 1985 studied faculty of economics

Occupations

researchersecretarypolitician

Biography

Taku Etō is a Japanese politician and a member of the House of Representatives He previously served as the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries in the Cabinet of Prime Minister Shinzō Abe.

Takao Fujii

Born in

Japan

Years

1943-.. (age 81)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Takao Fujii is a Japanese politician, an independent and member of the House of Councillors in the Diet (national legislature).

Katsuya Matsumura

Born in

Japan

Years

1963-.. (age 61)

Occupations

screenwriterfilm director

Biography

Katsuya Matsumura is a Japanese film director and screenwriter known for his violent thriller-horror film series All Night Long.

Shōko Yoshimura

Born in

Japan

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Occupations

amateur wrestler

Biography

Shoko Yoshimura is a retired Japanese Wrestler. She competed in 10 World Wrestling Championships and won 9 medals, including 5 gold medals.

Coppé

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Occupations

songwritersinger

Biography

Coppé is a Japanese electronic music singer-songwriter and music producer. She has affectionately gained the title of "The Legendary Godmother of Japanese Electronica". She has released fifteen solo albums on her self-owned Mango + Sweetrice label. She released the most acclaimed album of her career, "8", in 2004.

Mitsuyoshi Yanagisawa

Born in

Japan

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Mitsuyoshi Yanagisawa is a Japanese politician of the Democratic Party of Japan, a member of the House of Councillors in the Diet (national legislature). A native of Tōmi, Nagano and graduate of Seijo University, he was elected to the House of Councillors for the first time in 2004 after an unsuccessful run in 2001.
